conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the copper rod to determine current magnitude and direction.
Copper rod MN suspended horizontally in a magnetic field B, perpendicular to the paper.
Tension in wires balances gravitational force when rod is not energized.
When energized, current interacts with magnetic field producing magnetic force F_B.
Magnetic force F_B = I L B.
Tension decreases to 1/4 of original value when energized.
Remaining 3/4 of original tension balanced by magnetic force F_B.
Substitute F_B = 3/4 mg into F_B = I L B.
Solve for I: I = (3/4 mg) / (L B).
Direction of magnetic force must be upward to counteract gravity.
Using right-hand rule: magnetic field B points into paper.
For upward magnetic force, current must flow from M to N (left to right).
Final answer: Magnitude of current I = 3mg / 4LB, direction from M to N.
